title: What is the significance of the transfer of the Balance in the Zodiac, and how does it relate to mythology and traditional forms?
first_phrase: In the preceding text, the author discusses the confused meanings attributed to zodiac signs and traditional forms by different cultures. In the last 200 tokens, the author talks about the Greek version of the rebellion of kshatriya, depicted as the hunting of Calydonian boar by Atalanta and her fellow kshatriyas. The author claims that the name Calydon is found in Calidonia, the ancient name of Scotland, and identifies the forest of Calydon with Bronceniandia. Additionally, the author points out the symbolism of the boar and the bear in the legends of Atalanta and the Garden of the Hesperides, both linked to the descendants of Atlantis.

last_phrase: To conclude, the symbols of the boar and the bear, present in the legend of Atalanta and the Calydonian hunt, do not always represent opposition or conflict, but can also symbolize the spiritual authority and temporal power in their normal and harmonious relationships, as shown in the legend of Merlin and Arthur. These ancient myths and legends can offer valuable insights into our own modern lives and societal structures.
